title: BariCare App
info: HTML, CSS, Tailwind, JavaScript, React, Next.js, MongoDB, Node.js, Railway, Framer Motion
introduction: BariCare is a community-driven web application built using Next.js with React, a Node.js server, and MongoDB. It serves as a platform for sharing bariatric-friendly recipes.
Users can register and log in to access a collection of recipes, create their own recipes, and save recipes from other users.
The app features a warm and inviting design with earth tones to create a down-to-earth and relaxed atmosphere.
features: User Registration and Login: Users can create an account and log in to access the recipe collection and other features.
Recipe Creation: Authenticated users can create their own bariatric-friendly recipes and share them with the community.
Recipe Saving: Users can save recipes created by other users to their personal collection for easy access.
User-friendly Design: The app features a warm design with earth tones, creating a welcoming and relaxing environment for users.
Smooth Animations: Framer Motion library is used for adding smooth and engaging animations to the app.
technologies: Next.js: Next.js is a React framework that provides server-side rendering, routing, and other useful features for building web applications.
React: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, and it is the foundation of the frontend of the BariCare app.
Node.js: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime that allows running JavaScript code on the server-side, providing the backend for the BariCare app.
MongoDB: MongoDB is a NoSQL database used to store the recipe data and user information.
Railway: Railway is a cloud platform that allows deploying and hosting Node.js applications, replacing the previous deployment through Heroku.
Tailwind CSS: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework used for styling the app, providing a responsive and customizable design.
Framer Motion: Framer Motion is a popular animation library for React, used to add smooth and engaging animations to the app.

title: BariCare Website
introduction: BariCare Web is a web application built using Parcel as the bundler.
It provides a user interface for calculating BMI (Body Mass Index) and recommending appropriate surgical interventions based on user inputs.
The application utilizes HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to create an interactive user experience.
features: BMI Calculation: Users can input their weight and height to calculate their BMI (Body Mass Index) using the provided form.
BMI Result: The application displays the calculated BMI value and shows the corresponding weight category based on the BMI value.
Intervention Questions: Users can answer intervention questions related to previous surgery, diabetes, and hypertension.
Surgical Intervention Recommendation: Based on the user's BMI value and intervention question answers, the application recommends appropriate surgical interventions.
Reset Functionality: Users can reset the form and clear the result, intervention questions, and recommendations.
technologies: Parcel: Parcel is a web application bundler that simplifies the development process by automatically handling various build tasks.
HTML: HTML is used for structuring the content and elements of the web application.
CSS: CSS is used for styling the application and creating an appealing visual design.
JavaScript: JavaScript is used to add interactivity and functionality to the application, including form submission, result calculation, and recommendation generation.

title: Innovisor Website Redesign
info: UX/UI Design, Adobe XD/Figma, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Wordpress
introduction: Innovisor is a company that aims to transform organizations into collaborative, agile, and human workplaces by leveraging people data, algorithms, and predictive intelligence.
Their website required a redesign to align with modern standards and provide a satisfying user experience across desktop and mobile devices.
problem: The existing Innovisor website had an outdated and non-responsive design, particularly on mobile devices.
The main pain point identified was the need to update the website to meet modern standards, improve mobile responsiveness, and enhance the usability of case studies.
insights: Through user interviews and heuristic evaluation, three key insights were obtained:
Poor mobile experience: Users reported that the website did not scale well on mobile devices, resulting in a subpar user experience.
Issues with modal forms: Modal or pop-up forms for contacting the Innovisor team caused layout problems and hindered user interactions.
Usability challenges with case studies: Case studies were presented in an inconvenient manner, requiring users to download PDF files and lacking sorting options.
solution: Based on these insights, the website redesign focused on the following solutions:
Overall design enhancement: The website's design was updated with a focus on improving usability.
Mobile-first approach: Prioritizing the mobile experience ensured a responsive and user-friendly design across devices.
Embedded case studies: The case studies were integrated into the website, eliminating the need for PDF downloads, and a sorting feature was implemented.

title: Rice Mobile Shopping Experience
info: UX/UI Design, User Research, Usability Testing, Mobile Design
introduction: RICETERIA is part of the Danish homewares and accessories company, RICE, known for colorful melamine, handmade baskets, storage, and hand-glazed tableware.
Their website required a mobile shopping experience that aligned with their visual brand identity and provided a satisfying user experience on mobile devices.
problem: RICE's customers often browse products from their mobile phones, and the website wasn't properly optimized for mobile experiences, especially the checkout process.
The main pain point explored in this solution is the checkout process.
insights: Through user interviews and surveys, the following top 3 conclusions were drawn about RICE's customers and their desires for a satisfying mobile app experience:
Target audience: RICE serves a wide, general audience, but their main target group is women between the ages of 20 and 26 years old.
Visual style: Users enjoy the playful, young, and fun visual style of the company and would like to see that reflected in the mobile experience.
Latest products: Users want to stay informed about the latest products available in the app as RICE constantly releases new collections.
solution: Based on these insights, the mobile app focused on the following solutions:
isual brand representation: The design aimed to visually represent RICE's brand identity throughout the mobile app.
Easy product filter: An intuitive and easy-to-use product filter option was implemented.
Streamlined checkout process: The checkout process was optimized to provide an easy and satisfying experience for users.

title: The Usability of E-Learning Platforms at SDU
info: UX Design, User Research, Usability Testing
introduction: The University of Southern Denmark had recently switched from the Blackboard e-learning platform to itsLearning and the intention behind this study was to assess the usability of the new platform compared to its predecessor.
The aim was to investigate if the switch resulted in an improvement in the overall usability and user experience for students.
problem: The previous e-learning platform, Blackboard, had a bad user experience and deplorable usability, according to student feedback.
The main question to answer was whether the new platform, itsLearning, provided a more satisfying usability and overall user experience compared to its predecessor.
insights: To address the problem, two methods were employed to gather insights into the usability experience of students with the previous and current e-learning platforms.

A questionnaire was used to collect information about the students' experiences, which revealed that Blackboard's usability had an average rating of 1.9 on the Likert scale, indicating poor user satisfaction. However, the switch to itsLearning resulted in a significant improvement, with its usability receiving an average rating of 3 on the Likert scale, showcasing a 57% improvement over Blackboard. These findings highlighted the overall enhancement in usability and user experience with the adoption of itsLearning.

Usability testing was conducted to evaluate the students' interactions with the newly adopted platform, which included the think-aloud protocol, the time/error log, and interview data. The completion rate of the usability testing was 70% out of 100%. The tested users were also interviewed to rate the overall user experience of itsLearning, which received a 60% approval rate out of 100%. These testing methods provided valuable insights into the students' firsthand experiences and further verified the improvements in usability and user satisfaction with itsLearning.
solution: Based on the gathered insights, the following solutions were proposed to enhance the usability and user experience of the e-learning platform at the University of Southern Denmark:

Simplified interface: The user interface of itsLearning ought to be redesigned to be more intuitive and user-friendly, addressing the usability issues faced with the previous platform. This involves decluttering the interface, improving visual hierarchy, and utilizing consistent design patterns to create a seamless user experience.

Streamlined navigation: The navigation ought to be restructured to improve the ease of finding and accessing different course materials. For the navigation structure to be optimized, clear pathways need to be provided and reducing the number of clicks required to reach relevant content.

Clear information presentation: The content layout ought to be optimized to enhance readability and comprehension, reducing cognitive load for students. By employing appropriate typography, clear headings, and visual cues, the presentation of information needs to be made more user-friendly and conducive to effective learning.
